bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, October 19, 1907

div1.p: Ida Kissinger thanks Kelly for his financial support and notes that John Kissinger's health fails him at times.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, October 19, 1907
div1.p:
yours of the 14th
at hand together with cheque for
$246.50 and we dont know how to
thank you and our many kind friends
for the intrest all have Shown-
We Deposited the money in the
Bank and will use it when we
Postively have to the other money
sent we used for Winters Coal
and wood and Potatos and I can
say we felt Happy to know that
we will not Suffer for want of
fuel-

So many days last winter we
were at a loss to know what
to do but we mannaged and I
often wonder how. We both got
2
us some Clothing we were Very
much in need of we have not
spent a cent we felt was for.
Unnecessary use we had both
very poor clothing. but the Good
Lord. has Provided for us-
Mr Kissinger is feeling quite Ill
at times he gives out for a while
and of course that worries him
his head Hurts him quite a Lot
will close with love and best
Regards from Mr and Mrs John R-
Kissinger
606 E Keasy St
South Bend Ind
